docs.snippet: LEAD: It was a year when Hollywood insiders despaired of accurately predicting the Academy Award nominations. And when the nominations were announced, they were even more surprising than expected....

docs.snippet: LEAD: FAY, a murderous nurse, urges a widower, McLeavy, whose wife has been dead three days, to remarry at once, granting that a fortnight, perhaps, is ''a decent interval of mourning.'' Having done in his wife - and, it seems, seven of her own hu...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: FAY, a murderous nurse, urges a widower, McLeavy, whose wife has been dead three days, to remarry at once, granting that a fortnight, perhaps, is ''a decent interval of mourning.'' Having done in his wife - and, it seems, seven of her own husbands as well - Fay offers herself as the next Mrs. McLeavy, only she has her eye on Dennis, who also happens to be the undertaker, a bank robber and the bisexual lover of McLeavy's son

headline.main: ORTON'S 'LOOT' STAGED BY BOSTON POST ROAD

docs.snippet: LEAD: Because James LeMoyne wrote at considerable length on Nicaragua in his article on Costa Rican President Oscar Arias, I am compelled to respond to two inaccuracies....

docs.snippet: LEAD: The right questions were asked of the wrong men in the articles on Central American Peace (''Arias, Whom Can He Trust?'' by James LeMoyne, and ''Ortega: Can He Be Trusted?'' by Stephen Kinzer, Jan. 10)....

docs.snippet: LEAD: Billy Wilder is to receive the Irving G. Thalberg Award from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Oscar night, April 11. The award honors a body of work that ''reflects a consistently high quality of motion picture production.'...

headline.main: Billy Wilder to Receive The Thalberg Award

docs.snippet: LEAD: THE MORE THINGS CHANGE, the more they stay the same. Almost. The formal, traditional wedding is back, in many cases with unprecedented lavishness. Even second weddings are more festive today. But rather than following a standard script, more...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: THE MORE THINGS CHANGE, the more they stay the same. Almost. The formal, traditional wedding is back, in many cases with unprecedented lavishness. Even second weddings are more festive today. But rather than following a standard script, more brides and grooms are putting their personal stamp on the wedding ceremony and reception.
